intro: Picris divaricata, commonly known as the variable fumitory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense, racemose inflorescences. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating skin conditions and as a mild sedative.
